data.title: SMALL COLLEGE ROUNDUP: Shelton State avenges losses to Gadsden State
authors: From staff reports, The Tuscaloosa News
data.meta_description: GADSDEN | Shelton State Community College avenged its only loss by routing Gadsden State 91-76 on Thursday in men’s junior college basketball action. \n Shelton State improved to 25-1 overall, 9-1 in …
data.text:
GADSDEN | Shelton State Community College avenged its only loss by routing Gadsden State 91-76 on Thursday in men’s junior college basketball action.

Shelton State improved to 25-1 overall, 9-1 in the Alabama Community College Conference. The Buccaneers, who lost to Gadsden State on Jan. 23, extended their winning streak to seven games.

Curtis Parker, a 6-foot-8 sophomore center, led the Buccaneers in the rematch. Parker, who has signed with Murray State, finished with a game-high 24 points.

Reaynundo Sturdivant, a former Sumter County star, had 17 points, and Daryl Covington scored 11.

Shelton State led 51-32 at halftime.

Will Ginn led Gadsden State with 26 points. Maurice DuPree scored 17, and Reggie DuPree scored 11.

Shelton State plays at Wallace-Hanceville on Monday.

SHELTON STATE (91) | Parker 24, Sturdivant 17, Covington 11, Holland 9, Brown 8, McKinney 8, Sellers 5, Raines 5, Coleman 4. GADSDEN STATE (76) | Ginn 26, M. DuPree 17, R. DuPree 11, Rich 9, Reed 6, Thompson 4, Goodson 2, Lewis 1.

Stillman 75,

Paine College 68

AUGUSTA, Ga. | The Stillman College men’s basketball team ran its winning streak to five straight games Thursday with a 75-68 victory over Paine College in college men’s basketball action.

The Tigers trailed 37-36 at halftime, but shot 50 percent in the second half to knock off the second-place team in the Southern Intercollegiate Athletic Conference standings on its own floor.

Stillman also ended a four-game winning streak by Paine and moved within a half game of taking over second place in the standings with the victory. The Tigers improved to 13-6 in league play while Paine fell to 13-5 and completed a two-game sweep of Paine for the regular season.

“They’re playing good now," Stillman coach Leon Douglas said of his team. “I’m excited about the potential of this group. We’re playing the toughest teams in the conference on the road.

“Right now I couldn’t ask for anything more from my kids. They’re playing great defense, tremendous defense."

Monyea Pratt posted a double-double to lead Stillman, scoring 26 points to go with 13 rebounds. Rickey Gibson added 17 points and eight rebounds and Wayne Bender grabbed eight boards to go with nine points.

Titus Lucas scored 13 points to lead Paine.

Stillman (16-8) will visit SIAC leader Benedict on Saturday night in Columbia, S.C.

STILLMAN (75) | Pratt 26, Gibson 17, Bender 9, Shields 9, Rolley 7, Campbell 4, Dannelle Smith 3, PAINE (68) | Lucas 13, Harper 9, Jones 8, Jackson 8, Lomax 7, Latson 7, Campbell 5, Overstreet 4, Durham 3, Quinn 2, Casey 2.

Shelton State 79,

Gadsden State 67

GADSDEN | The 15th-ranked Buccaneers avenged their only in-state defeat, putting together a 23-0 run in the first half to take early command of its game against Gadsden State, ranked No. 11.

Shelton State won its seventh straight game to move into first place in the Alabama Community College Conference North Division standings. The Buccaneers improved to 25-2 overall, 8-1 in the conference, while Gadsden State fell to 23-3, 7-2 in the league.

“It’s just a confidence-booster," Shelton State coach Madonna Thompson said. “To let them come to our gym and beat us on our home floor, that’s not something we want to happen. We wanted to come back and prove we could beat them and let them suffer a loss on their home floor, too.

“We have goals, and we want to finish the conference No. 1."

Shaquita Bell scored 27 points to lead Shelton State. Tia Jackson added 13 points, with Melody Hudson scoring 10. Shaneka Bates grabbed eight rebounds for Shelton State.

Emily Mason scored 19 points to lead Gadsden State, with Maria Grimes adding 18 and Mallory Morring scoring 10.

Shelton State (25-2, 8-1 in conference play) will visit Wallace-Hanceville on Monday.

SHELTON STATE (79) | Bell 27, Jackson 13, Hudson 10, Martin 7, Freeman 6, Bates 6, West 4, Phillips 2, Toole 2, Allen 2. GADSDEN STATE (67) | Mason 19, Grimes 18, Morring 10, Houts 7, Scott 6, George 4, Debtor 3.

Stillman 64,

Paine College 60

AUGUSTA, Ga. | Aisha Brown scored 15 points, grabbed eight rebounds and blocked five shots to lead Stillman (10-14 overall, 8-8 in SIAC play).

Vanchericka Mitchell scored 11 points and Tenessia Robertson added 10 for Stillman.

Savoyia Barrett scored 15 points to lead Paine, with Akia Stanton adding 14.

Stillman will visit Benedict on Saturday.

STILLMAN (64) | Brown 15, Mitchell 11, Robertson 10, Burton 8, Todd 6, Pugh 6, Johnson 5, Mansfield 3. PAINE (60) | Barrett 15, Stanton 14, Murray 8, King 6, Reed 6, Cunningham 4, Lucette 3, Bell 2, Hutchins 2.

Shelton State 3,

Gulf Coast CC 2

PANAMA CITY, Fla. | Center fielder Cody McMurry hit a two-run home run to held lead Shelton State Community College to a 3-2 victory against Gulf Coast in baseball Thursday.

Jake Edwards gave up just one hit over 61/3 innings and struck out three. David Slovak (1-0) gave up two runs in two innings, but earned the win.

Sophomore designated hitter Robert Livingston had an RBI-single.

Shelton State (1-3) with play Truett-McConnell of Georgia today, and Gulf Coast again.
